Reason: The 'trickle_fsync' configuration is considered performance-sensitive because it directly impacts system performance by determining when to fsync() at intervals during sequential writing. This operation can have a notable performance variation at the system level by affecting read latencies and disk I/O operations. The configuration involves time-expensive operations like fsync() calls, which can lead to significant performance impacts, especially on SSDs. Therefore, the 'trickle_fsync' configuration is classified as performance-sensitive.
